page.title: 04SCHOOLS IN PENDLESIDE
page.content: The{oldest of the 3 schools in the {area is Roughlee, built in 1852}by 3 local Textile Manufacturers.Various alterations and improvements have been made over the years.There are{2classes catering, at present, for 15 children {from 5-11}years,but numbers have been as high as 48 at times.It is a "Contro lled" school, which means that the local church appoints 2 of the Govern- ors.A{full range of subjects is taught including the use of the Computer. {WhitehoughCampSchool}was an innovation at its opening in 1938 by the Borough of Nelson.It became a school for deli- cate children during the war and re- opened in 1945,having 3 hutted blocks: dormitories,classrooms and staff rooms A permanent Head Teacher was appointed in1955 who set up the wide variety of courses offered now:FieldStudies,Camp- craft,Mapreading,Caving,Canoeing etc.
